original_transcript: Trainee: Thank you for calling Northwestern Mutual, Underwriting Case Management, this is ________. How may I help you? SYM: Hi! This is Norm Weston calling from John Barrett's office. This case for Marty Juana has taken forever, what is the underwriter waiting on? Trainee: Hi Norm, may I start with a policy number to get started? SYM: This case for Marty Juana has taken forever, what is the underwriter waiting on? The policy number is T195129. Trainee: Thank you, Norm. Give me one moment to pull up the case. Trainee: Thank you, Norm, I do have Marty's case pulled up here. You would like to talk about what will move this case to approval, is that correct? SYM: Yes, that is what I'm looking for. Trainee: Please give me a moment so I can review the details of the case and see what we can do to get this moving. SYM: Sounds good! Trainee: Thank you so much, I am all up to speed on this case. It looks like we are awaiting records from Dr. Smith's office and that a special authorization was sent to your office by the APS vendor to be reviewed. Do you have a copy of that completed form? SYM: No, I thought you sent it to the client and not just to me. Trainee: Thank you, Norm. Let me take a moment to review the notes from our APS vendor to determine where the document was sent. SYM: Please do, I hope you sent it to the client. Trainee: It doesn't appear that this was sent directly to the client, instead it was sent to your office to facilitate that request. I can have that resent to you right away. SYM: Ok, that is fine. Do you really need these records though? It's been a long time. Trainee: It does look from the notes that the underwriter does require these notes in order to reach the final decision, however, I will put in a note requesting for a risk review and the underwriter will reach out with that information. In the meantime, I'll get the form over to you to reduce any further delay. SYM: That sounds fair. Thank you. Trainee: Of course. Is there anything else I can assist you with? SYM: No, that was all. Trainee: Awesome, well thank you so much for putting your trust in Northwestern Mutual. Have a great rest of your day. SYM: Thank you, you as well!
extraction:
{
  "reason": "Customer asked what the underwriter is waiting on and how to move the Marty Juana case toward approval, requesting the necessary records/authorization form.",
  "steps": [
    "Pulled up the case using policy number T195129 and confirmed the customer's goal to move the case toward approval.",
    "Reviewed the case details to identify what the underwriter is waiting on (records from Dr. Smith's office and the special authorization from the APS vendor).",
    "Asked the customer if they had a copy of the completed authorization form; learned that they did not.",
    "Checked APS vendor notes to determine where the document was sent and confirmed it was sent to the office, not directly to the client.",
    "Offered to resend the completed form to the client to reduce delay.",
    "Noted that the underwriter requires the notes to reach a final decision and planned to place a risk-review note, with the underwriter providing the missing information.",
    "Committed to sending the authorization form to the client to help prevent further delays.",
    "Asked if there is anything else the customer needs and closed with thanks."
  ]
}

original_transcript: SYM: [Phone rings] Trainee: Thank you for calling Zinus, this is (Agent's Name), may I have your name and email address, please? SYM: Hi. My name is Alexis and email is cloudchaser252@gmail.com. Trainee: Thank you, Alex! How can I help you today? SYM: We just ordered a bed and a mattress. It was actually delivered last week. Mattress was fine, there's just something about the bed frame. We're kind of not - liking the color. I think we still have the return period so we would like to take advantage of it and we will buy something else. Trainee: We're sorry to hear the bed frame did not work out for you. We can take a look at your options and discuss the return process. May I have your order number, please? SYM: Yes it's 3-3-0-0-3-0. Trainee: Thank you! Please bear with me while I validate your order. Trainee: I see an order placed January 9, 2024 for a bed frame and a mattress. To confirm the item that needs to be returned, that would be Olivia Metal and Wood Platform Bed Frame in Full size, correct? SYM: Yes. That is correct. Trainee: Looking at the tracking details, it shows it was delivered January 13, 2024. I can confirm that you are still within the 30 days of your return period, Alex. Trainee: To initiate the return, the bed frame needs to be returned back to us. Ensure that the item will be returned in its original packaging - complete with all original parts including the instruction manual. Trainee: We will then send you a prepaid return label and provide instructions for arranging a FedEx pickup. Trainee: After we receive the returned item, a refund will be generated back to the original form of payment within 2-3 business days. We will email you all these details right after this call. Trainee: I hope I was able to explain the process of the return. Is there anything else I can help you with at the moment, Alex? SYM: Nope. Sounds good. I will wait for your email. Trainee: Awesome! If you have any questions, feel free to respond to the email anytime. And thank you for calling Zinus, we hope you have a wonderful day! SYM: Thanks! You too! SYM: This concludes your simulation.

original_transcript: SYM: In this simulation, you will assist the customer with setting up of automated gift for the child. Trainee: Hello, good afternoon. Thank you for calling Compassion. My name is [YOUR NAME]. How can I assist you today? SYM: Hi! I got a letter saying that my child is turning 16 today, and I thought I had to set up as an automated birthday gift. Every year he gets a birthday gift. Trainee: Thank you for being a sponsor and wanting to send a gift to your sponsored child. It's a wonderful way to show your care and support. SYM: Thank you. Do you want my account number or anything? Trainee: Yeah. May I know your sponsor number if you have it on hand? SYM: Yes, the number is X 1 Y 2 Z 3. Trainee: Thank you. Can you verify the first and last name on the account. SYM: Kim Reeves. Trainee: Alright, I have pulled up your account. And first, I would like to thank you for being part of Compassion since 2016 and for being a blessing to your two children. You do have Jim from Peru and Michael, that is from Rwanda. And with regards to the birthday gift, it looks like you haven’t setup a birthday gift here on the account. The only thing that you have set up is the automatic withdrawal for your monthly sponsorship for the birthday gift. SYM: Okay. Trainee: Regrettably, we don't have it here on the account. That means you didn't send a birthday gift to your child because you don't have any automatic set up of birthday gifts. SYM: Well, I thought it was already set up. So, if you could set it up today as an automatic gift and I can make a payment today on it. You need a card? Trainee: Let me check it here on the account. You do have here a visa card ending in 5252. Is it the one that you are using? SYM: Yeah, that one's good to use. Can you put it for $40? Automated birthday gift? Trainee: Yeah. Thank you so much for that. That would be $40 annually. And since we didn't receive one for today, we will be making one time birthday gift today. And then the next one would be on November 17, 2024, right? SYM: To do one today and the one in November? Trainee: Yes. Because it takes two to three months before it will be reflected on the account or it will be given to the child. Is it only for your child in Peru or are we going to set up for the one that is from Rwanda, for a month? SYM: I thought you said that one was already on automated. Trainee: It was on the automated, but you already sent one on last May 2023. You also sent one-time payment of a one-time birthday gift, but it wasn't setup on the automated payment. SYM: Let me just wait on that right now. When is his birthday again? Trainee: Yeah, it looks like your child's birthday, Michael is in July. Do you want to set it up today? SYM: Yeah, I'll do that a little bit later. I just wanted to get this one done today because I got an email that today was his birthday. I missed it. How long is it going to take for the area there to get this for him? Trainee: Yeah, it takes two to three months before they will be receiving the gift that you have sent to them. SYM: All right. Trainee: I'll just submit it here. So that would be the $40 pretty gift or annual pretty gift into the account. SYM: All right. And you have it set up as automated now, right? Trainee: Yes, that is correct. SYM: All right, thank you. Trainee: Everything is set now. Is there anything else I could help you with? SYM: No, that's it. I appreciate it. Trainee: Thank you for your time. Have a nice day. SYM: You too. Bye! SYM: This concludes your simulation.

  ]

original_transcript: SYM: It’s closing time for this module. SYM: So, let’s recap all your learnings, move it to the phones. SYM: I hope you have learned something new. SYM: Throughout the call, you work hard to gain trust, establish credibility, discover needs, and utilize that information to find the right product for that caller’s needs. SYM: However, you can’t get the sale if you don’t ask! That’s the importance of closing. SYM: We should be asking for the sale immediately after providing the price. SYM: This is why a best practice during the discover process is to ask the budget question last, because it is a natural transition to price. SYM: By asking the budget question last, you are in a better position to successfully close because you have all your information you need to know to offer the right product based on the customers needs. SYM: There are multiple closing techniques you can use. SYM: Find the one that works best for your personality and call style. SYM: You don’t have to use the same one every time, don’t be afraid to step outside your comfort zone and try something new! SYM: Hearing no can and will happen to everyone in a sales role. SYM: There is not a closing technique that guarantees everyone will say yes. SYM: Remember to catch it, catch it, change it when it comes to hearing no on calls. SYM: You will hear more no’s than yes’s and that’s okay. SYM: So don’t be afraid to go for no - that means you at least asked for the sale! SYM: It’s officially closing time, open all the queues and let you out into those calls!
extraction:
{
  "reason": "No specific customer issue is provided; the transcript is a closing-focused sales training module describing how to handle closing after discovering needs and presenting price.",
  "steps": [
    "Prepare for closing by recapping learnings and transitioning to live calls.",
    "Work to gain trust and establish credibility with the caller.",
    "Discover the caller's needs and gather relevant information during the discovery phase.",
    "Use the gathered information to identify the right product for the caller's needs.",
    "Ask the budget question last, creating a natural transition to presenting price.",
    "Provide price and immediately proceed to closing, using a closing technique suited to the caller's personality and call style.",
    "Choose and apply multiple closing techniques as appropriate; don’t rely on a single method.",
    "If the caller says no, acknowledge it, catch the objection, and adapt or try alternative closing approaches.",
    "Accept that no’s are common; stay persistent and keep aiming for the sale (go for no).",
    "Wrap up the module by signaling closing time and preparing to move the caller to the next steps (open queues to handle more calls)."
  ]
}

original_transcript: Trainee: Thank you for calling Xfinity Mobile, we appreciate your business. This is (YOUR NAME). May I have your name please? SYM: My name is Danerra Lamburth. Trainee: What a beautiful name! Is it okay if I call you by your first name? SYM: Sure, that's fine. Trainee: Awesome! How are you doing today, Danerra? SYM: I'm doing fine, thank you. How about yourself? Trainee: I'm glad to hear that. I'm doing great as well. Thank you for asking. Tell me, how may I help you today? SYM: I received the SIM card the other day, and as of today, it is still not activated. Trainee: Thank you for clarifying that for me! I'd be happy to assist you with activating your new SIM card. To begin the process, I need to access your account first. I'll be asking you a few questions for security purposes; would that be fine? SYM: Sure! Trainee: Great! Can you please provide me with your billing address on file? SYM: 6000 Hollister St, Apartment 1 8 1 6, Houston, Texas 7 7 0 4 0. Trainee: How about the last four digits of the credit or debit card on file? SYM: 4 9 8 0 Trainee: Thank you, Danerra, for providing all the necessary information to access your account. Your cooperation is appreciated. I was able to pull up your account, and I can see that you have two iPhone devices. May I know the mobile number of the device on which you would like to activate the new SIM card? SYM: (560) 346-9876 Trainee: To ensure that I got the correct number, which is (560) 346-9876, is that correct? SYM: Yes, that's correct. Trainee: Nice! How about the ICCID number of the new SIM card? SYM: Where can I find that? Trainee: The ICCID for your Xfinity Mobile SIM card can typically be found printed on the SIM card itself or on the SIM card packaging. It is a unique 20-digit number that identifies your SIM card. If you're unable to locate the ICCID on the SIM card or packaging, you can find it in the settings of your phone once it's inserted. On your iPhone, go to Settings > General > About. The entry titled ICCID is your SIM card number. SYM: I found it! The number is too small on the card. That is 8 9 1 4 8 0 0 0 0 0 9 8 7 6 5 4 3 2 1 0. Trainee: To confirm, it is 89148000009876543210, am I right? SYM: Yes. Trainee: Thank you for confirming it. Let me go ahead and update the new SIM card on your phone. This may take a few minutes to complete the process, and I'll be asking you to reset the network settings of your phone afterwards. SYM: Sure. Take your time. Trainee: Okay, here's what I found out, Danerra. Your SIM card is not activated because of the pending order on the account. And this needs to be completed before your SIM card can be activated. SYM: It's been three days; I am confused as to why my phone is still not working, and is this the only reason why? Trainee: So please give me a moment while I am working on it. I will let you know once the pending order is completed and to activate the SIM card. SYM: Sure, take your time. Trainee: All right, Danerra. I was able to activate and update your new SIM card. Kindly insert the new SIM card and reset the network settings on your phone. Before that, I would like to set your expectation that any saved Wi-Fi networks and passwords will be removed and all paired devices will be unpaired. So, after you reset the network settings, please set up your phone so everything will be connected again. Just go to Settings > General > Reset. Then select "Reset Network Settings" and confirm your choice when prompted. After the reset, your phone will restart. Please test the call functionality afterwards. SYM: I already inserted the SIM card and reset the network settings. My phone is restarting now. Trainee: Once your phone is back on, please check the network connectivity and let me know if everything is working as expected. SYM: Sure, I will. Trainee: While your phone is restarting, I'd like to express my gratitude for being a valued [Silver, Gold, Platinum, or Premium] customer with Xfinity Rewards. As a loyal customer, you have access to exciting rewards and exclusive benefits. The longer you stay with us, the more rewards you can enjoy. You can conveniently access your rewards anytime through the Xfinity app or by visiting www.xfinity.com/rewards. SYM: Thank you. Trainee: Thank you, Danerra! Your loyalty means a lot to us. Don't forget to make the most of the rewards we offer. We have a range of exclusive benefits and perks specifically tailored for customers like you. If you ever have any questions or need assistance in maximizing your rewards, feel free to ask. We're here to help! SYM: I appreciate you sharing that. And I just tested the network, and it's working perfectly now! Thank you for your assistance. Trainee: You're most welcome, Danerra. Is there anything else I can assist you with? SYM: No, that was all I needed. I really appreciate your prompt and efficient support. Trainee: It's a collaboration with you! Just for a quick recap, you contacted Xfinity today to activate your new SIM card, which is now working as a replacement for the number ending in 9876. Then I asked you to insert the SIM card and reset the network settings. You confirmed that everything is working after testing it. SYM: Thank you so much! Trainee: It's been a pleasure taking care of your needs today, and I appreciate your collaboration and patience while we resolved your issue. Thank you, and have a great rest of your day! SYM: Thanks, you too! SYM: This concludes your simulation.
extraction:
{
  "reason": "Customer needed help activating a new Xfinity Mobile SIM card; activation was blocked due to a pending order on the account.",
  "steps": [
    "Step 1: Verified identity and security by asking for billing address on file and last four digits of the credit/debit card.",
    "Step 2: Retrieved account, confirmed there are two iPhone devices, and identified the target line to activate as (560) 346-9876.",
    "Step 3: Requested ICCID of the new SIM card; customer provided 89148000009876543210.",
    "Step 4: Updated/attempted to activate the new SIM card in the account and informed it may take a few minutes; advised customer to reset network settings after activation.",
    "Step 5: Identified root cause: a pending order on the account preventing activation; explained the need to complete the pending order and that activation would occur once it is processed.",
    "Step 6: After pending order was completed, activated and updated the SIM; instructed customer to insert the SIM and reset network settings, warning that saved Wi-Fi networks would be removed and paired devices would be unpaired.",
    "Step 7: Customer inserted the SIM, reset network settings, and restarted the phone; customer tested network connectivity to confirm operation.",
    "Step 8: Customer confirmed the network was working; agent provided closing remarks and thanked the customer."
  ]
}

original_transcript: Trainee: Thank you for calling Walt Disney World Resorts, where celebrations are our specialty. My name is {Stage Name}. How may I assist you? SYM: Hello, I would like to make a reservation. Trainee: I’d be happy to assist you and thank you for choosing Disney as your vacation destination. Trainee: May I have your last name and email address? SYM: Callahan, and my email is jcallahan at animail.net. Trainee: Thank you, Joan! What dates and how many nights would you like to stay with us? SYM: Checking-In on November 24th, 2025, and Checking-Out on November 30th, 2025. Trainee: Thank you, Joan, who will be traveling with you? SYM: My husband Klein. Trainee: Thank you, Joan, who else will be traveling with you? SYM: My son, Carrillo. Trainee: Thank you, Joan, will there being anyone else traveling with you? SYM: Yes, my daughter Bridget. Trainee: Thank you. Trainee: Have you decided on which resort you would like to stay at? SYM: Contemporary Resort. Trainee: Have you stayed at this resort before? SYM: We have; we love the resort, it’s our favorite. Trainee: It’s one of my favorites also. I love how the Monorail travels through the middle of the resort. Trainee: Joan, will you need theme park tickets? SYM: Yes, a 6-day ticket with the Park Hopper Plus. Trainee: Would you like to include a dining plan? SYM: Yes, I’d like the Disney Dine Plan. Trainee: Would you like to include vacation protection in your package for only $95.00 per adult inclusive of children up to 17 years old? It can cover trip cancellation and trip interruption. SYM: No, thanks. We will need 2 rooms as we would like the kids to have their own room. Trainee: I will be happy to assist you, please give me a few moments to check the availability. Trainee: Would you like to include Memory Maker? Memory Maker is an incredible way to enjoy unlimited digital Disney Photo Pass photos captured at hundreds of locations throughout Walt Disney World Resort—including select attraction and dining locations. The photos are conveniently connected to your online Disney account with a touch of your MagicBand, MagicMobile or Key to the World Card. It is regularly $210, with the advanced price of $185 if purchased at least 3 days prior. SYM: No, thanks. Trainee: Will you be flying or driving? SYM: We’re flying. Trainee: Will you need a rental car? SYM: No, we don’t need one. Trainee: Joan, I do have availability, at Disney’s Contemporary Resort, with a Garden Wing – Resort View, with 2 Rooms arriving on November 24th, 2025, checking out on November 30th, 2025, with the Disney Dining Plan and a 6 Day Park Hopper Plus Theme Park Ticket Valid Monday, November 24th, 2025, thru Wednesday, December 3rd, 2025, your total cost will be $15,727.38 Without travel protection, including tax. This would not include the overnight parking fee that will be charged at the resort upon arrival.​ Trainee: Would you like to secure the reservation for you and your family today? It will only be a $200 deposit the remaining balance will be due 30 days prior to arrival. SYM: Yes, this sounds perfect.​ Trainee: Joan, I do have a few policies to review: A deposit of $200.00 is due on August 20, 2025. The balance is due on October 25, 2025. Modifications within 29 days of arrival are subject to a $50.00 change fee. If you cancel the reservation 29-2 days before arrival, there is a $200 cancellation fee. If you cancel the reservation the day prior to or the day of arrival, the full package price is non-refundable. Gratuity is not included with the Dining Plan. Your Tickets will be valid Monday, November 24th, 2025, to Wednesday, December 23rd, 2025. Trainee: Do you have any questions? SYM: No, I don’t. Trainee: Joan, I have a reservation for you, Klein Callahan, Bridget Callahan (4 years old), and Carrillo (12 years old). Staying at Disney’s Contemporary Resort in a Garden Wing – Resort View Room with 2 Rooms, Disney Dining Plan and 6 Day Theme Park Ticket with the Park Hopper Plus – Checking in on November 24th, 2025, – Checking out on November 30th, 2025. Trainee: Your confirmation number is 27015181. Trainee: Your deposit of $200.00 is due on August 20th, 2025, with the remaining balance due 30 days prior to arrival on October 25th, 2025. Trainee: Your total reservation is $15,727.38. Trainee: Would you like to use your Disney Visa Card for your deposit today? SYM: Yes, please. Trainee: Joan, may I have your credit card number, please? SYM: 4 2 6 6 - 9 0 2 0 - 0 0 1 8 - 4 2 2 4. Trainee: Thank you. Trainee: May I have the expiration month and year, please? SYM: December 2025. Trainee: Thank you. Trainee: Joan, is the name and address on the reservation the same name and address on your credit card? SYM: Yes. Trainee: Joan, would you like to use this credit card for charges incurred during your stay? SYM: Yes. Trainee: Joan, your remaining balance is $15,527.38 due 30 days prior to arrival, October 25th, 2025. Trainee: Joan, you can link your reservation to MyDisneyExperience.com or the mobile app. Trainee: Our website and app also allow you to book and manage your upcoming ticket, park and dining reservations at Walt Disney World. Trainee: You can begin booking your dining reservations 60 days prior to arrival. Trainee: Is there a birthday or anything special you will be celebrating during your visit that you would like me to note? SYM: No, thank you. Trainee: Joan, is there anything else I can assist you with today? SYM: No, thank you! Trainee: I have a survey at the end of the call and would greatly appreciate your feedback. Thank you for calling Walt Disney Resorts. We look forward to seeing you in November. Have a Magical Day.

original_transcript: Trainee: Carnival Fun Ships, this is [Agent Name]. May I have your name, please? SYM: My name is Alice Test. Trainee: Hi, Alice. Are you currently booked on one of our Fun Ships or working with a Travel Advisor? SYM: No, I’m calling in to see if you can help me plan my cruise. Trainee: I’ll be happy to get your cruise booked today. Trainee: May I have your phone number? SYM: Sure, it is 305-222-3333. Trainee: Thank you! Trainee: What state do you live in? SYM: Florida. Trainee: Thank you. Trainee: Alice, may I have your email address? SYM: Sure! It's alice test@email.com. Trainee: Thank you! May I have your address? SYM: Sure! It's 1 2 3 Maple Street, Miami, Florida, 3 3 1 0 1. Trainee: Thank you. Trainee: Have you cruised with Carnival before? SYM: No, this is my first cruise. Trainee: Welcome to Carnival. I’m so glad you chose to sail with us. Are you celebrating anything special? SYM: I’m just wanting to plan a fun getaway vacation for just myself and my husband. Trainee: Fantastic! So, it sounds like you are looking for one cabin for two guests, right? SYM: Yes. Trainee: Would anyone traveling have the need for special accommodations or is pregnant? SYM: No. Trainee: And to make sure I don’t miss any promotions for you, is anyone traveling an employee of an interline company such as a passenger airline, Amtrak, or UPS or FedEx? SYM: No. Trainee: Anyone serve in the U.S. Armed Forces, Canadian National Defense or over the age of 55? SYM: No, not yet. Trainee: Has your husband sailed with Carnival before? SYM: No. Trainee: And you mentioned earlier, you live in Florida, correct? SYM: Yes Trainee: What ship and sail date have you picked out? SYM: I’m interested in sailing on the Carnival Breeze sailing April 1, 2027. Trainee: I’m glad you are calling in to book today, that’s a popular time to travel over spring break. Bear with me a moment as I pull that up. Trainee: Your cruise will be on the Breeze sailing April 1, 2027, out of the port of Galveston on a 4-day Western Caribbean itinerary. Your boarding time is from 12:30 p.m. to 2:00 p.m. and you will be visiting Cozumel, Mexico with 2 fun days at sea. SYM: Yes, that's the one we want. Trainee: Awesome! Trainee: Your ship, the Breeze, has 14 passenger decks. It has an adult serenity retreat that is only for guests 21 and older where you can sit back, relax, and smell the sea breeze. It also has a seaside theater where you can watch movies under the stars. There are some great additional food options too, like Guy’s Burger Joint, which has the best burgers. SYM: My husband loves burgers. Sounds good! Trainee: Great! Trainee: Things included in your cruise are breakfast, lunch, dinner, snacks, ice cream, pizza, comedy shows, and our amazing stage shows. Not included are our spa treatments, alcoholic beverages, carbonated beverages, gratuities, and if you want to try your luck in our casino at sea. SYM: This sounds perfect for us. Trainee: Great! Now, let’s find you the best deal for your cruise. Trainee: We have a lot of great promotions. I’m seeing the best promotion for you today is our Early Saver Promotion. Trainee: The Early Saver promotion guarantees you the lowest rate from the day that you book all the way until two business days prior to your sailing. If at any time the rate drops below what you booked at, you can fill out a price protection form online and have the balance adjusted before final payment or get the difference as an onboard credit after final. Keep in mind this promotion does not allow name changes and if you cancel or move your sailing prior to final payment date it’s only $50 per person fee and the rest of the money gets put towards a future cruise credit which you have 12 months to use. SYM: Okay. Trainee: What kind of cabin would you prefer? They're all very spacious. We have an interior cabin with no windows, an Ocean View with a big picture window, a Balcony cabin that gives you both a window and your own private balcony, and our largest option - a Suite, which has even more space and a balcony. SYM: We would like to have a Balcony cabin. Trainee: Great choice! That’s my favorite, too. Trainee: I’m looking forward to finding you a great balcony. Trainee: I found a great cabin for you. It’s on our Lido Deck, Deck 10. There are only 4 cabins left that accommodate 2 guests on this deck so I’m glad you called in today. This will put you in the middle of the ship. Let’s look at the details about your cabin. Trainee: Your cabin has 220 square feet, two twin size beds that will convert to a king for you, and your own private balcony. One of the best things about a balcony is how you can enjoy your morning coffee or a glass of wine at night while you enjoy the sounds, smell, and view of the ocean from your own private balcony. SYM: Sounds perfect for us. Trainee: Awesome, let me get the pricing for your cabin. Trainee: Your cabin is only an average rate of $829 per person including taxes and fees based upon 2 guests in the cabin. Carnival Vacation Protection is $190 for the cabin, giving you a total of $1848.00. Trainee: All we need to get started today is a small deposit of $340, which includes activation of your Carnival Vacation Protection. The remaining balance won't be due until your final payment date of 1/16/2027. Would you like to book this with early, late or your-time dining? SYM: Let’s book for a late dining. Trainee: Wonderful! Trainee: One moment while I grab your cabin. Trainee: I have the perfect cabin for you, cabin number 10277. Trainee: After this call, you will receive an email confirmation. Please read the terms and conditions of your email cruise ticket contract, as you are legally bound by the terms. SYM: Okay. Trainee: May I have each name as it appears on their travel documents? SYM: Alice Test 05/14/1985 and James Test 9/24/1984. Trainee: Thank you! Just to confirm, that was Alice Test with date of birth 05/14/1985 and you said it was your husband traveling with you, James Test, with his date of birth 9/24/1984? SYM: That is correct. Trainee: Is everyone traveling a U.S. Citizen and U.S. Resident? SYM: Yes, we are. Trainee: Thank you! Trainee: And you mentioned earlier you both live in Florida, correct? SYM: Correct. Trainee: Would you like to go ahead and include your prepaid gratuities, or will you be taking care of that onboard? SYM: I think I’ll handle that onboard. Trainee: Okay, thanks! Trainee: I selected your dinner time as Late Dining as you requested earlier. SYM: Great! Trainee: Please choose a 4-digit pin number that is easy for you to remember for security purposes. SYM: How about 2 4 8 7. Trainee: 2487, got it! Trainee: And to confirm does anyone traveling have a special need or pregnant? SYM: No Trainee: And you mentioned earlier you were sailing for a fun get away. No special occasions, right? SYM: Correct, not this time. This time it is just for fun. Trainee: Thank you! Trainee: May I have your email address so we can contact you in case of itinerary changes or voyage delays?​ SYM: Let’s use my same email earlier for me at alice test @ email.com and james test @ email.com for my husband.​ Trainee: Thank you! Trainee: May I have an alternate contact telephone number? SYM: Sure, my cell phone is 305-222-3333. Trainee: Thank you! Would you like a text to be sent to your mobile number for all sailing changes and payment reminders? SYM: Yes, please. Trainee: Bear with me a moment as I finish creating your booking. SYM: Okay. Trainee: I’m almost done. I’m just putting some additional notes on your booking. Trainee: Your booking number is X9SN55. You are sailing on the Breeze doing a 4-day Western Caribbean itinerary. We have you in that amazing balcony cabin, 10277. The total cost of your cruise is $1848 with only your deposit of $340 due today. Trainee: Are you taking care of this payment now or would you like to hear more about our partner, Flex Pay, where you could book this for as little as $0 down and pay for up to 24 months with affordable rates? SYM: I’m going to use my Visa Card. Trainee: Okay, great! Trainee: May I have the name of the card holder? SYM: It’s my name on the card.​ Alice Test. Trainee: May I have the expiration date and billing zip code? SYM: It is April 2028, and my zip code is 3 3 1 3 3. Trainee: Thank you, I have April 2028 and zip code of 33133, correct? SYM: Yes. Trainee: Would you like to pay just the deposit of $340 today? SYM: Yes, the deposit only. Trainee: As a courtesy for you, we can go ahead and set up Auto Pay for you interest free and split your final payment amount into equal amounts of $71.81 starting on May 1, 2025. Would you like to go ahead and take advantage of this? SYM: Yes, let’s go ahead and set that up. Trainee: Okay, perfect. Trainee: Now that I’ve verified the name of the cardholder, expiration date, zip code, and payment amount, I will be placing you into Secure Mode where I will prompt you to enter your credit card number. ​ ​ Trainee: During this time, you will be able to hear me, however, I will not be able to hear you. It is important that when entering your credit card number, you are not using speakerphone or a Bluetooth device. ​ Trainee: After you input your credit card number, Secure Mode will drop, and our call will reconnect, allowing me to hear you again. Then, I can verify payment. Do you have your credit card ready? SYM: Yes. Trainee: Do you have any questions before I place you into Secure Mode?​ SYM: No. Trainee: You are now in Secure Mode. Please enter your credit card information. Trainee: Thank you for your payment of $340.00. Before I submit, are the last few digits 4444? SYM: Yes. Trainee: I see your payment of $340.00 has processed. Trainee: I am going to send your cabin confirmation now. Trainee: You are all set. Keep in mind that adding or removing a guest will change the average rate per person. Please refer to your confirmation that I am emailing you now or you can go on the website to carnival.com/bookedguest for your electronic documents, boarding pass, travel docs, and penalty information. SYM: Okay. Trainee: Proper travel documentation is due upon embarkation and Carnival highly recommends a passport. Trainee: Is there anything else I can help you with today? SYM: That’s all. Trainee: Super! As a reminder, you will be receiving an email survey about my service today. I appreciate your feedback. SYM: Sure, you really made this whole process very easy. Trainee: Thank you for choosing Carnival and you have a Funtastic day!

original_transcript: SYM: In this simulation, you will learn how to open a call, when the customer has called in to identify whether a procedure is covered by their health insurance. SYM: STEP 1 - Opening. SYM: [Phone rings] Trainee: Thank you for calling ABC Health Insurance. My name is [YOUR NAME]. How may I assist you today? SYM: Hi, my name is Ash. I wanted to inquire if a specific medical procedure is covered by my health insurance. Trainee: Of course, Ash. I'm here to help. May I have your first and last name? SYM: Ash Harris. Trainee: I appreciate it. Can you please provide me with your policy number so that I can access your account? SYM: Sure, my policy number is A B C 1 2 3 4 5 6. SYM: This concludes your simulation.

SYM: Congratulations on running your first sym. Now lets see how you did. From here you can already see your Completion Time, Keyword and Click score. SYM: Keywords are structure words in the the conversation that are good word choices or can even be compliance words that must be said. If the sym has no agent lines you will not have a keyword score. Click score is scoring where on the visual components of the sym you navigated and clicked through during the process. Click score will only be in visual syms. SYM: All of the playbacks for every sym you execute will always be in Playback on the left side of the screen, last tab, with the headphone icon. SYM: For now, Click the Green View Playback button to see more detail on how you did. SYM: Starting at the top left, you can see every attempt you have completed of this sym, and the playback for each. This allows you to see how you are improving with each attempt. SYM: You can also see if you completed it in Practice or Test Mode, the day and time completed, and you can even click re-attempt and do it again. SYM: Next you will see your Sym Accuracy Score. This measures how well your response matched the intent of what the customer was asking in the customer script line. If this is a beginner sym your score should be in the 90% range, because you would have said the script line pretty close to word for word, to learn the intent. In Intermediate and Advanced Syms, when you are formulating your own words, this score might go down, but you want to aim for the 80-90% range, so that your intent is matching the need of the customer as closely as possible. If your sym has no agent lines you will not have a sym accuracy score. SYM: Completion time is important because if it is taking you longer to navigate the conversation and screens, it can be an indication that you just need to practice the beginner sym more to learn the process better. It won't take long before you will know exactly what to do. Keep practicing. SYM: The first number in the keyword score is your score, and the second is the possible score. Keywords are structure words that are good word choices you will want to say, or they can even be compliance words you must say. Keywords guide you to the best and fastest way to customer resolution and satisfaction. SYM: The first number in the click score is your score, and the second is the possible score. Click scores are the places on the screens where you clicked, and it scored you if you clicked in the correct place. SYM: The Sym Score will equal a combined score of the different scoring options. If a sym has all three, Sym Accuracy, Keyword and Click Score, the sym score will be total of all, as one sym score. If a sym has two or only one of these scoring options, the sym score will equal the total of only the scoring options used in that sym. SYM: Text Field Keyword score will appear if the sym was created with keywords in the Text Fields that can be put into visual syms. A best practice is to always enter text into those fields exactly as directed because you never know if that text will be a keyword or not until you finish. SYM: Confidence, Concentration and Energy are your sentiment scores. These scores are calculated by the level of intent you deliver the script line in the areas of confidence, concentration and energy. These are not calculated on your voice or tone, but on how confident your level of intent is, how your focus or concentration level and how your pace or energy level of intent is. The sentiment score is calculated for the entire sym, not one part or another. SYM: The measurement for sentiment scores will be High, Medium or Low, and you can click the insights to learn more about what you did well, and what you can do to improve. SYM: As a reminder you will not receive a sentiment score in your practice attempts, only in your test attempts, and if your sym has no agent lines, you will not have a sentiment score. SYM: The playback also allows you to listen to a recording of you executing the sym. You can click a script line below and the recording will skip to that part of the recording if you wanted to only listen to a certain part. SYM: If you see a dot in the recording like this, this is the Text Field Key Word Score we just talked about. This will show you if you got that word or if you missed it. As you can see I missed it because it is red, and it gave me the correct response. SYM: The bottom part of the playback page is the actual script. The highlighted words are the keywords. If they are green I got them. If they are red I missed them. You will also notice the KS and SA and then a number score, like 3/4 and a percent, such as 86%. These are your Keyword Scores and Sym Accuracy scores by script line. The first number in the keyword score is your score and the second is the possible score. The Sym Accuracy score tells you how you did in this line with intent compared to the customer script line you were responding to. SYM: This gives you the ability to see exactly in the sym where you can improve on keywords and sym accuracy. The total Sym Accuracy and Keyword scores at the top are a total of these by script line totals. SYM: And finally you will always see the scripted line with the keywords you said or did not say vs what you said in response. The default is to show both, but you can toggle that off if you want to just see the scripted line and the keywords you said or did not say. SYM: Great Job! This concludes your simulation.

{
  "reason": "No real customer issue is described in the transcript. it focuses on training/assessment of performance within a sym playback system rather than addressing a customer’s problem.",

original_transcript: SYM: You have already opened the call and verified customer details. In this simulation, you will gather information and resolve the customer's concern. SYM: STEP 2 - Gather Information. Trainee: Thank you, Ash. Let me pull up your policy information. While I do that, could you please provide me with the details of the medical procedure you're inquiring about? SYM: I'm considering getting a knee surgery called arthroscopic meniscectomy. I wanted to know if it's covered under my policy. Trainee: I understand. Let me check the specifics of your coverage. Just give me a moment, please. Trainee: Thank you for waiting, Ash. I have reviewed your policy, and I can confirm that arthroscopic meniscectomy is covered under your health insurance plan. However, it's important to note that coverage can vary based on factors such as medical necessity, network providers, and any applicable deductibles or co-payments. SYM: That's great to hear! Could you please provide me with some additional information? For instance, do I need a referral from my primary care physician before scheduling the surgery? Trainee: That's an excellent question, Ash. According to your policy, you do not require a referral from your primary care physician for this specific procedure. However, it's always a good idea to consult with your doctor or surgeon to ensure that the surgery is appropriate for your specific medical condition. SYM: I see. Thank you for clarifying that. Now, I'm also curious about the coverage limits and any out-of-pocket expenses I may incur. Trainee: Certainly, Ash. Let me go over that with you. Your policy has a coverage limit for surgical procedures, and I can see that it includes coverage for this specific surgery. As for out-of-pocket expenses, it's important to review your policy documents or contact our claims department to determine any deductibles, co-payments, or coinsurance that may apply. SYM: I'll make sure to review my policy documents. Lastly, could you provide me with a list of in-network surgeons or facilities that perform this procedure? Trainee: Absolutely, Ash. I can assist you with that. Please bear with me while I access the network provider information. SYM: No worries. Trainee: Thank you for your patience, Ash. I have compiled a list of in-network surgeons and facilities that perform arthroscopic meniscectomy in your area. I will email you the list to the email address we have on file. Additionally, you can also visit our website or contact our customer service line to obtain this information. SYM: That's perfect. Thank you so much for your help. You've been very informative. SYM: This concludes your simulation.

SYM: In this sym, we will review how the UCSL application varies based on state. SYM: Reminder that we can not C O P whole life applications for Connecticut or Montana. SYM: New York has its own application for our Guaranteed Whole Life policy. We’ll go into detail on New York later. SYM: The states in red on the map have some different verbatim messages that will appear in the e App. SYM: Remember that these boxes are verbatim statements. SYM: You should not try to memorize these, as they may change for each state. SYM: Always be sure to read what's on your screen word for word. SYM: One such example is with California, the final application verbatim has an additional paragraph regarding fraud. SYM: This allows us to be compliant with California law. The fraud statement is also provided in the policy documents. SYM: Again, this is why you should not memorize verbatims. Simply follow the application. SYM: Another California law requires we obtain an email address from our California elders (which is age 65 or older) so we can send them pertinent disclosures before the application is completed. SYM: To comply with the California law, there is a verbatim early in the application regarding consent to electronic delivery and e-signature. SYM: The verbatim and email address field is mandatory, and the e-app will prevent you from continuing the application if you do not enter in a valid customer email address. SYM: Once you have entered the email address in the box you must press the Send button. If you don’t press this button, the e-app will prevent you from continuing the application. SYM: If the email fails to send, the Send button will turn red and will say Fail. SYM: The e-app will prevent you from moving forward until an email has successfully been sent. SYM: If the email successfully sends, the Send button will turn green and will say Sent. SYM: Once you have received the green Sent message, you need to ask the customer to verbally confirm they received the email. SYM: This is what the email that the customer receives looks like. SYM: Here’s another question that will only appear during the application in certain states. SYM: These states have state special questions and verbiage that is required to be read about accessing PDF files via the internet and providing their consent to receive electronic documents. SYM: The state requires we review this electronic consent. SYM: We're asking if they can access the internet in any shape or form. SYM: If they say no, you can clarify by asking if they have access to the internet (smart phone, library, etc.). SYM: If they still answer No, you will need to explain to the applicant that if they are not able to access the internet, or do not provide their consent, you will not be able to take their application over the phone and it will need to be mailed to them. This may delay the processing time and the effective date of their policy. SYM: Let’s practice a state specific scenario! Click the arrow when you are ready to begin. Trainee: Have you received an application packet? SYM: No. Trainee: Are you able to open, view and save P D F files via the internet? SYM: No. Trainee: Do you have access to the internet by using a smart phone or going to the library? SYM: Oh, yes. I can do that. Trainee: I am required to obtain your consent for the delivery of electronic documents to you whether through the internet, email, web, text, instant message, digital media or the like. Your consent applies to all documents Mutual of Omaha may be required to deliver to you in writing. Any document provided to you electronically may be provided in paper upon your request. You may withdraw your consent at any time. If you withdraw your consent, I will not be able to complete your application over the phone and I will need to mail you a paper application. You may withdraw your consent, update your contact information or obtain a paper copy of any document for no charge, by contacting (800) 775-6000. You will need access to a computer or other device which provides internet access or email, as well as the ability to open, view and save a PDF, text or html file. Trainee: Do I have your consent to provide you with the necessary documents electronically? SYM: Yes Trainee: Disclosures are made available to you at the following website: http://www.mutualofomaha.com/wholelifedocuments SYM: Great job practicing one of those state specific items in the e App. SYM: What did we learn today? Take a moment to review some of the key learnings from this sym. SYM: Click the lightbulb when you are ready to continue. SYM: Understanding that the e App will vary by state ensures compliance with state-specific rules and regulations, helping us navigate the process accurately and effectively.

original_transcript: SYM: Hello and welcome to our ABC BackOffice tool training. Here, we will learn how to create a prescription request for a client. All the data that you will enter in this simulation is sample data. This is a practice sym, once you get on a live call, the data will be based on the interactions with the caller. SYM: You will first enter the customer’s contact reason in the highlighted fields. SYM: Now, you'll write the customer's full name by clicking on the First Name and Last Name fields on the page. SYM: After entering the customer's full name, click on search. SYM: You will now validate the customer's date of birth for security verification purposes. SYM: You will now search for the name of the medication the customer is looking to get a prescription for. Use the sample data as advised. SYM: Once you've found the medication details in the system, you'll confirm with the customer if they have ever been prescribed this medication when you take a live call. SYM: Subsequently, you'll write down the dosage and quantity of the medication requested by the customer on a live call. SYM: Write in the customer's complete address with the zip code in the required fields. SYM: For the delivery process, you'll check the options available in the Delivery dropdown and choose accordingly. SYM: Finally, enter the primary healthcare provider's name and phone number. SYM: Once you have entered all the details, you'll click on Save to record the information and the task will be completed and assigned. SYM: Good job! You have now completed training on "How to create a prescription request for a customer". Click on the screen to finish and wait for your trainer to give you further instructions. SYM: This concludes your simulation.

original_transcript: Trainee: Thank you for calling Northwestern Mutual, Underwriting Case Management, this is ________. How may I help you? SYM: Hi! This is Norm Weston calling from John Barrett's office. This case for Marty Juana has taken forever, what is the underwriter waiting on? Trainee: Hi Norm, may I start with a policy number to get started? SYM: This case for Marty Juana has taken forever, what is the underwriter waiting on? The policy number is T195129. Trainee: Thank you, Norm. Give me one moment to pull up the case. Trainee: Thank you, Norm, I do have Marty's case pulled up here. You would like to talk about what will move this case to approval, is that correct? SYM: Yes, that is what I'm looking for. Trainee: Please give me a moment so I can review the details of the case and see what we can do to get this moving. SYM: Sounds good! Trainee: Thank you so much, I am all up to speed on this case. It looks like we are awaiting records from Dr. Smith's office and that a special authorization was sent to your office by the APS vendor to be reviewed. Do you have a copy of that completed form? SYM: No, I thought you sent it to the client and not just to me. Trainee: Thank you, Norm. Let me take a moment to review the notes from our APS vendor to determine where the document was sent. SYM: Please do, I hope you sent it to the client. Trainee: It doesn't appear that this was sent directly to the client, instead it was sent to your office to facilitate that request. I can have that resent to you right away. SYM: Ok, that is fine. Do you really need these records though? It's been a long time. Trainee: It does look from the notes that the underwriter does require these notes in order to reach the final decision, however, I will put in a note requesting for a risk review and the underwriter will reach out with that information. In the meantime, I'll get the form over to you to reduce any further delay. SYM: That sounds fair. Thank you. Trainee: Of course. Is there anything else I can assist you with? SYM: No, that was all. Trainee: Awesome, well thank you so much for putting your trust in Northwestern Mutual. Have a great rest of your day. SYM: Thank you, you as well!

original_transcript: SYM: Hello! original_transcript: SYM: [Mario wants to know why a Zelle payment is not showing up in his account] Trainee: Thank you for calling. How can I help you? SYM: Yeah, what's going on here? My buddy just sent me some money through Zelle but it never made it into my account. I saw him do it. But the money's not in my account. You guys either lost it or stole it. I need you to find it and put it in my account NOW.  Trainee: I'd be happy to assist you. What is the account the money is going into? SYM: [snarky] Why, so you can steal even more? I had to enter it just to get connected to you. Why do I have to give it again?  Trainee: We have to ask for security reasons. SYM: [exasperated] OK it's 2 2 2 2    2 2 2 2    2 2 Trainee: Thank you. I'm checking now to see if the transfer is pending. SYM: What do you mean PENDING? This is supposed to be INSTANT. Just put the money into my account.  NOW. Trainee: One moment please.  SYM: [sighing loudly] Trainee: So, the reason the funds haven’t processed yet is that your e-mail address is not registered. SYM: No way. I DID give my email. I set this up a few days ago, I know I did. Go register it NOW and put my money in the account NOW. Trainee: I’m sorry about it, but for security reasons I can’t do it for you. But if you login, I can walk you through the one click process. SYM: Are you kidding me? Fine. But this better be the LAST TIME I register my email. You guys are idiots.  Trainee: I understand your frustration. Now, see the box that says ACTIVATE EMAIL on your home screen? Click on that please. SYM: Alright, fine.  Trainee: Thank you, that took care of it. You should see the funds  now. SYM: This completes your simulation.

original_transcript: Trainee: Thank you for calling Barnes and Noble. My name is (Your Name). How can I help you? SYM: Hi. I placed an order and wanted to know the status. I should have received my order by now. I really need the books to give them as a gift next week. Trainee: I'm sorry you haven't received your order. I would be happy to check the status of your order. Can I have your order number, please? SYM: My order number is 4 1 3 6 3 3 3 9 3 0. Trainee: Thank you. One moment while I locate your order. SYM: No problem. I appreciate it. Trainee: Can I have you verify your email address, please? SYM: Sure. My email address is anita napp at gmail.com. Trainee: Great, thanks! What is your shipping address, please? SYM: My address is 5 7 2 Angel Place, Sunny, California 9 0 2 1 0. Trainee: Thank you. Just a moment please, while I research your order. Trainee: Thank you for your patience. I can see your order shipped on January 17th and was expected to be delivered by January 24th. One moment while I review the tracking details. SYM: Okay, thanks. I appreciate your help. Trainee: Thank you for your patience. I've checked the tracking, and I can see that is was delivered on January 24th. Have you checked your mailbox and all of the doors? SYM: Yes. I checked everywhere, and I still can't find the package. Trainee: I'm going to consider your order lost in transit. Give me a moment while I check the available options. SYM: Sure. Trainee: Great news! I have the items in stock, and can have your order replaced free of charge. Would you like me to replace them? SYM: Yes, I want them replaced. I need them for a gift next week. Trainee: Absolutely! Due to the inconvenience, I will upgrade the shipping level as well. SYM: Ok, thanks! That would be great, and will help so much! Trainee: Of course. It's my pleasure since you didn't receive them. Trainee: Are there any changes to the delivery address that we need to make? SYM: No, it will go to the same address, but can you add apartment B onto the shipping address? Trainee: Yes, I can update the address to include your apartment number. Trainee: The expected delivery date for your order would be on Friday, February 3rd. SYM: Ok, sounds good. That should be before the party. Trainee: You'll receive an email confirming the order shortly. You will also receive a shipping confirmation email when the order ships, which includes tracking information. Trainee: Your new order number is 6180000649. I will also email you a return label in case you receive the original and the replacement. SYM: I just received the first email. Thank you. Trainee: You're welcome. Is there anything else I can assist you with? SYM: No, that's it. Thanks! Trainee: Thank you! Have a great day, and thanks for calling Barnes and Noble.

original_transcript: SYM: In this simulation, you will learn how to create an F N O L claim for a car insurance company. SYM: STEP 1 - Opening. SYM: [Phone rings] Trainee: Thank you for calling ABC Insurance. My name is [YOUR NAME]. How may I assist you today? SYM: Hi. I need to file a car insurance claim for an accident I was just involved in. SYM: STEP 2 - Gather Information. Trainee: I'm sorry to hear about the accident. Let's start by making sure we have all the necessary information. May I have your first and last name? SYM: Pat Davis. Trainee: Thank you, Can you please provide me with your policy number? SYM: Yes, it's A B C 1 2 3 4 5 6. Trainee: Thank you, Pat. I see your policy here. Now, could you please provide me with the date and time of the accident? SYM: The accident occurred today, May 17th, 2023, at around 3:30 p.m. Trainee: Got it. And can you briefly describe what happened during the accident? SYM: I was driving on Main Street when another car ran a red light and crashed into the driver's side of my vehicle. It was a T-bone collision. Trainee: I'm sorry to hear that. Is everyone involved in the accident safe and is anyone injured? SYM: Fortunately, no one was seriously injured, but both cars sustained significant damage. Trainee: I'm glad to hear that no one was hurt. Safety is our top priority. Now, could you please provide me with the contact and insurance information of the other party involved in the accident? SYM: The other driver's name is Sarah Johnson, and her phone number is (555) 123 - 4567. I also have her insurance information. Her insurance company is XYZ Insurance, and her policy number is D E F 9 8 7 6 5 4. Trainee: Thank you for providing that information, Pat. Now, I need to gather some details about your vehicle. Can you please provide me with the make, model, and year of your car? SYM: Sure. I drive a 2018 Honda Accord. Trainee: Great. And do you have any photos of the accident scene or the damage to your vehicle? SYM: Yes, I took some pictures with my phone. I can send them to you if needed. Trainee: That would be helpful, Pat. Please send the photos to our dedicated claims email address, which is claims@insurance.com. Make sure to include your policy number and a brief description of the accident in the email. SYM: Okay, I'll do that right away. Trainee: Thank you, Pat. Lastly, is there anything else you would like to add or any specific questions you have about the claims process? SYM: Not at the moment. I just want to get my car repaired as soon as possible. SYM: STEP 3 - Setting Expectations. Trainee: Understood, Pat. We will do our best to expedite the claims process for you. Once we receive your email with the photos, an adjuster will be assigned to your case, and they will reach out to you within the next 24 to 48 hours to discuss the next steps. SYM: I appreciate it. Trainee: Is there a preferred phone number or email address where they can contact you? SYM: Yes, they can reach me at (555) 987 - 6543 and my email is pat@email.com. SYM: STEP 4 - Closing. Trainee: Perfect, I have noted down your preferred contact information, and the adjuster will be in touch soon. Thank you for reporting the accident, and we will assist you throughout the entire claims process. If you have any further questions, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. SYM: Thank you. I appreciate your help. Trainee: You're welcome, Pat. Take care, and we'll be in touch soon. SYM: This concludes your simulation.

SYM: In this simulation, you will help a customer identify whether a procedure is covered by their health insurance. SYM: STEP 1 - Opening. SYM: [Phone rings] Trainee: Thank you for calling ABC Health Insurance. My name is [YOUR NAME]. How may I assist you today? SYM: Hi, my name is Ash. I wanted to inquire if a specific medical procedure is covered by my health insurance. Trainee: Of course, Ash. I'm here to help. May I have your first and last name? SYM: Ash Harris. Trainee: I appreciate it. Can you please provide me with your policy number so that I can access your account? SYM: Sure, my policy number is A B C 1 2 3 4 5 6. SYM: STEP 2 - Gather Information. Trainee: Thank you, Ash. Let me pull up your policy information. While I do that, could you please provide me with the details of the medical procedure you're inquiring about? SYM: I'm considering getting a knee surgery called arthroscopic meniscectomy. I wanted to know if it's covered under my policy. Trainee: I understand. Let me check the specifics of your coverage. Just give me a moment, please. Trainee: Thank you for waiting, Ash. I have reviewed your policy, and I can confirm that arthroscopic meniscectomy is covered under your health insurance plan. However, it's important to note that coverage can vary based on factors such as medical necessity, network providers, and any applicable deductibles or co-payments. SYM: That's great to hear! Could you please provide me with some additional information? For instance, do I need a referral from my primary care physician before scheduling the surgery? Trainee: That's an excellent question, Ash. According to your policy, you do not require a referral from your primary care physician for this specific procedure. However, it's always a good idea to consult with your doctor or surgeon to ensure that the surgery is appropriate for your specific medical condition. SYM: I see. Thank you for clarifying that. Now, I'm also curious about the coverage limits and any out-of-pocket expenses I may incur. Trainee: Certainly, Ash. Let me go over that with you. Your policy has a coverage limit for surgical procedures, and I can see that it includes coverage for this specific surgery. As for out-of-pocket expenses, it's important to review your policy documents or contact our claims department to determine any deductibles, co-payments, or coinsurance that may apply. SYM: I'll make sure to review my policy documents. Lastly, could you provide me with a list of in-network surgeons or facilities that perform this procedure? Trainee: Absolutely, Ash. I can assist you with that. Please bear with me while I access the network provider information. SYM: No worries. Trainee: Thank you for your patience, Ash. I have compiled a list of in-network surgeons and facilities that perform arthroscopic meniscectomy in your area. I will email you the list to the email address we have on file. Additionally, you can also visit our website or contact our customer service line to obtain this information. SYM: That's perfect. Thank you so much for your help. You've been very informative. SYM: STEP 3 - Closing. Trainee: You're welcome. Can you confirm your email address for me? SYM: That would be Ash@email.com Trainee: Thank you, Ash. I'm glad I could assist you. If you have any further questions or need any additional information, please don't hesitate to reach out to us. We're here to help you make the most of your health insurance coverage. SYM: I appreciate that. Thanks again for your assistance. Trainee: It's my pleasure, Ash. Take care, and have a great day! SYM: This concludes your simulation.

original_transcript: SYM: Welcome back! Congratulations on completing your first sym a moment ago. Now let’s see how you did. SYM: Before we get started, I want to draw your attention to the sym time length on the opening screen of each sym. SYM: This lets you know on average how long it should take to complete the sym. SYM: Take a moment to look for the “Time Elapsed” located at the top of this sym. SYM: As you work through syms, be sure to keep an eye on your pace so you can finish within the allotted time for the assignment. SYM: Let’s proceed full steam ahead! SYM: Reminder, here are some best practices for navigating throughout a sym. Click the arrow when you are ready to continue. SYM: After completing a sym, you will be directed to a screen that looks like this. SYM: From here you can already see your Completion Time, Keyword Score, and Click Score. SYM: To view more details on your sym score, click View Playback. SYM: This playback view provides more insight on your performance. SYM: You can see if you completed the sym in Practice or Test Mode, the day and time completed, and you can even click re-attempt and do it again from here. SYM: Here is that completion time again. SYM: Completion time is important because if it is taking you longer to navigate the conversation and screens, it can be an indication that you just need to practice the sym more to learn the process better. SYM: Let’s break down the other stats on the screen, starting with Keyword Score. SYM: Keywords are structure words in the conversation that are good word choices or can even be compliance words that must be said. If the sym has no agent lines, you will not have a keyword score. SYM: The DSC is not a scripted environment. The key words chosen throughout the syms will be ones that everyone should say. SYM: For example, everyone should state “Mutual of Omaha” in your call introduction. SYM: The first number is your keyword score, and the second is the possible score. SYM: In that last sym, I got 3 out of 4 keywords correct. SYM: To see which one I missed, I can scroll down to find it in the playback. SYM: Words highlighted green indicate you got the keyword correct, while red indicates it was missed. SYM: Here I can see that I missed the first word, hello. SYM: You can click the Trainee Response to jump to that part of the recording, then click Play to listen. SYM: After listening to my playback, I could here that I said hello, but the microphone didn’t start picking up right away so the greeting was cut off. SYM: Technology is not perfect. There could also be times where it thought you said a different word. For example, application and occupation can sound similar to a computer. SYM: That is why the training team and your supervisors review playback on lower scoring syms. SYM: This allows them to see if it was a system error or a coaching opportunity. SYM: Scroll back to the top to look at the rest of the sym score. SYM: Let’s review Click Score next. SYM: Click Score is scoring where on the visual components of the sym you navigated and clicked through during the process. Click score will only be in visual syms. SYM: The first number is your click score, and the second is the possible score. SYM: In that last sym, I got 19 out of 19 clicks correct. Way to go me! That is a good indicator that I understand the process in the sym. SYM: Confidence, Concentration and Energy are your sentiment scores. SYM: These scores are calculated by the level of intent you deliver the script line in the areas of confidence, concentration and energy. SYM: These are not calculated on your voice or tone, but on how confident your level of intent is, your focus or concentration level, and your pace or energy level. SYM: The sentiment score is calculated for the entire sym, not one part or another. SYM: My Energy score was Medium. I can click Insights to view more. SYM: This is where I can find insight on how to improve that score if I were to take it again, or helpful advice for future syms. SYM: Next let’s look at the Sym Accuracy Score. SYM: This measures how well your response matched the intent of what the customer was asking in the customer script line. SYM: SymTrain is still working on improvements to the Sym Accuracy score, and this is being monitored by the training team at the moment. SYM: The final stat to look at is the Sym Score. SYM: This will equal a combined score of the different scoring options for that sym. If this is a beginner sym your score should be in the 80% range. SYM: Again, technology is not perfect. That is why the training team and supervisors will take a look at those lower scores to see if it was a system error or a coaching opportunity for improvement. SYM: Now that we’ve reviewed how to look at detailed playback after completing a sym, let’s head to the Playback page. SYM: The Playback page provides an overview of your sym performance for all your completed syms. SYM: To view the detailed playback for any sym, simply click the Actions icon. SYM: This concludes the simulation. SYM: What did we learn today? Take a moment to review some of the key learnings from this sym. SYM: Click the lightbulb when you are ready to continue. SYM: Fantastic job completing SymTrain 1 0 1! You are ready to continue your learning journey and start taking syms! Bon voyage!
extraction:
{
  "reason": "The user needs guidance on how SymTrain metrics and playback features work and how to improve performance in completing syms.",
  "steps": [
    "Introduced the session and explained the Time Elapsed metric on the opening screen to set expectations for pace.",
    "Advised the trainee to monitor pace to finish within the allotted time for the assignment.",
    "Shared best practices for navigating syms and prompted to proceed to the next step.",
    "Described what appears on the Completion screen: Completion Time, Keyword Score, and Click Score, plus the option to View Playback.",
    "Explained that View Playback provides detailed insights, including mode (Practice or Test), date/time completed, and the option to re-attempt.",
    "Highlighted the importance of Completion Time as an indicator of whether more practice is needed to learn the process.",
    "Explained Keyword Score: what keywords are, how the first/second numbers are shown, and how to see which keyword was missed via Playback.",
    "Noted potential system issues or misrecognitions (e.g., similar-sounding words like 'application' vs 'occupation') and that playback is reviewed for coaching opportunities.",
    "Explained Click Score: how it measures navigation through visual components, and gave an example where all clicks were correct (19/19).",
    "Introduced sentiment scores (Confidence, Concentration, Energy) and what they reflect (level of intent, focus, and pace), clarifying they are overall for the entire sym.",
    "Mentioned Insights as a way to view guidance for improving sentiment scores and preparing for future syms.",
    "Described Sym Accuracy Score as a measure of alignment with the customer's intent and noted it is still being improved by the training team.",
    "Summarized the overall Sym Score as a combined metric and typical beginner range (around 80%), with acknowledgment of potential system errors.",
    "Guided the trainee to the Playback page to access detailed performance for all completed syms and how to view specific playback by clicking the Actions icon.",
    "Concluded the simulation and encouraged continuing the learning journey."
  ]
}

SYM: In this simulation we will determine the learning style of each person. SYM: This is a screen navigational simulation. Follow the instructions provided throughout the simulation and complete the sym. SYM: This is the Hotspot. You would need to click on it to type in the answer or you would need to click on it to move to the next step. After typing in the details, you would need to click the 'enter' key to move forward. SYM: Concentrate on each slide detail to WIN the quiz at the end. SYM: There are several types of learning, categorized based on theories, approaches, and settings. Here’s an overview SYM: Visual learners understand best through pictures, charts, and diagrams. They prefer shapes and patterns over words or speech. Teachers can help by using tools like graphic organizers to explain ideas clearly. SYM: Auditory learners learn best by hearing and speaking. They enjoy lectures, group discussions, and talking through ideas. They often figure things out by speaking first, rather than planning what to say. SYM: Reading & writing learners understand best through words. They enjoy reading and do well with written tasks like stories or reports. They prefer learning through text, such as reading books or writing notes. Teachers can help by asking them to explain diagrams or charts in writing, which they can review later to remember the information. SYM: Kinesthetic learners learn best by doing. They like hands-on activities, real-life examples, and practicing skills through physical actions. Teachers can help by giving them practical tasks, like recreating experiments or working through examples to understand new ideas. SYM: Now let’s determine your learning style through a quick evaluation. SYM: Tip: [Now you’ve to speak the correct option showing on the screen based on your preferences and click “Next” to proceed.] SYM: What was the arrow color in the previous slide? SYM: Write down in the text box given. SYM: Click on ‘FINISH’. SYM: Congratulations!!! Nows've completed the assessment. Your trainer will tell you the result. SYM: This concludes your simulation.
